intro: Calystegia longipes, commonly known as the long-footed bindweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Calystegia longipes produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
